title: Why Grandma Always Wore Feathers
text:
Preface
To Ruth Hall and Corena Spells the best grandmothers any young boy could ask for. Thank you for teaching me about our Choctaw heritage growing up, hopefully this short story makes you proud.
Why Grandma always wore Feathers: A Choctaw Story

title: Once upon a time
text:
Once upon a time, in a small town where dreams would gather, lived a young Black kid, his name was Jasper.
Curiosity bloomed in his heart, a flame to tether, for he wondered why his grandma wore a feather.

title: Adorned with Pride
text:
Every day, she adorned her head with pride, a feather so vibrant, it couldn’t hide.
It danced with grace, as if it could glide, intriguing young Jasper, his questions multiplied.

title: Why Do You Wear That?
text:
“Grandma,” he asked, eyes wide with wonder, “Why do you wear that feather, like thunder?”
With a smile, she replied, voice soft like a summer, “Come, my dear, let me share the story, no need to lumber.”

title: Heritage We Embrace
text:
“In our veins, the blood of warriors flows, a heritage we embrace, a bond that only grows.
The feather signifies strength, as history shows, a reminder of the power that in our spirit bestows.”

title: A Legacy Cherished
text:
Through generations, stories were passed, A legacy cherished, it would forever last.
Orally spoken, they held their past, and their connection to the land, steadfast.

title: Grandmother’s Stories Unfolded
text:
Jasper listened, his heart filled with pride, as his grandmother’s stories unfolded wide.
He felt the echoes of the past collide, a sense of belonging, he couldn’t hide.

title: Embracing His Roots
text:
As the years went by, Jasper grew, embracing his roots, like morning dew.
He wore a feather too, a tribute anew, and his spirit soared, the way feathers do.

title: Heritage Danced in His Head
text:
Now, every night as he lay in his bed, thoughts of heritage danced in his head.
He understood the stories his grandmother had said, how the Choctaw Indians had fought and bled.

title: A Guiding Light
text:
The feather became a symbol, a guiding light, a reminder of their ancestors’ brave fight.
Their spirit alive, burning bright, a heritage cherished, with all their might.

title: A Story of Resilience
text:
And so, the tale of young Jasper weaves, a story of resilience, where love achieves.
Embrace your roots, let them shape and conceive, for within lies wisdom, and the power to believe.

title: Embrace Your Heritage
text:
So, for who's ever listening, remember this tale to be true, embrace your heritage, let it guide you through.
Just like the feather, may your spirit soar and pursue, the dreams that await, and the greatness within you.
